item.title: Question assumptions—especially your own
item.description: The Law of Unintended Consequences states: “Assumptions are the root of all failures.“Of course, the wording isn’t very serious, but when assumptions cost you several thousand (or even millions) of dollars, it’s no laughing matter. The experience of software architects indicates that the rationale for each decision made should be documented, especially if the decision involves a compromise (between performance and maintainability, between cost and time to market, etc.).In a more formal approach, the context in which each decision is made is recorded, including the factors that influenced the final choice. Such factors can include not only functional or non-functional requirements but also facts (or “factoids”) that seem important to the decision-maker (such as technology constraints, employee qualifications, the political environment, etc.). The practice of documenting decisions is useful because listing these factors helps to highlight the implicit assumptions that influence important decisions regarding the designed product.
